The '''1991 Gator Bowl''' was a [[bowl game|postseason]] [[college football]] match between [[Oklahoma Sooners football|Oklahoma Sooners]] and the [[Virginia Cavaliers football|Virginia Cavaliers]] at the [[Gator Bowl Stadium]] in [[Jacksonville, Florida]]. The University of Oklahoma represented the [[Big Eight Conference]] and Virginia represented the [[Atlantic Coast Conference]] (ACC) in the competition. The game was the final competition of the [[1991 NCAA Division I-A football season|1991 football season]] for each team and resulted in a 48â14 Oklahoma victory, even though [[spread betting|spread bettors]] favored Virginia to win by 1.5 points. The key factor in Virginia's demise was that they could not hold the scrimmage line. Cavalier fans that made the long trip to Jacksonville were heard throughout the crowd saying "they just can't hold the line" <ref name="ref1"/>
+

The University of Oklahoma represented the [[Big Eight Conference]] and Virginia represented the [[Atlantic Coast Conference]] (ACC) in the competition. The game was the final competition of the [[1991 NCAA Division I-A football season|1991 football season]] for each team and resulted in a 48â14 Oklahoma victory, even though [[spread betting|spread bettors]] favored Virginia to win by 1.5 points.<ref name="ref1"/>
